page.title: 10AGRICULTURE
page.content: A modern farmer uses modern technology instead of intensive labour as in the past. Machinery will do the work of many men. A{COMBINE HARVESTER costing at least Â£35,000 will probably only be in use for three weeks in a year. It will be driven by one man, it will cut the corn, separate the grain from the stalk on the field and when it has ten tons it will unload onto a trailer without stopping. The grain is taken to the farm where it is stored using blowers and conveyors. If the grain is damp, warm air is blown through it. It is constantly moved about to keep it fresh until it is sold. This may be up to a year later. Immediately after harvest more machinery quickly cultivates the soil and the farmer sprays weeds and sows most of next years crops well before the autumn is over.
